com.flyingspaniel.nava.callback

Class Callbacks

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flyingspaniel.nava.callback.Callbacks

  • public class Callbacks
extends Object
    Utilities for dealing with Callbacks

        public static Object runSync(Callback callback,
             Object data,
             Object... more)
                      throws Exception
        Runs a callback (and any associated chain) synchronously
        Parameters:
        callback - first callback, if null, data will be returned immediately
        data - input to first callback
        Returns:
        result from the final callback
        Throws:
        Exception

      • callableRunSync

        public static Callable callableRunSync(Callback first,
                       Object inData,
                       Object... more)
        Wraps runSync() in a Callable so it can be run in another thread
        Parameters:
        first - if null, returns inData
        inData - inputs to the first callback
        more - inputs to the first callback
        Returns:
        result from the final callback

      • runASyncInLine

        public static Object runASyncInLine(ExecutorService xs,
                    Callback callback,
                    Object data,
                    Object... more)
                             throws Exception
        Runs a completedCallback (and any associated chain) using an ExecutorService However, since we wait for the Futures "in line" here, no real speed gain (see runASyncInLine)
        Parameters:
        xs - if null, they get run sync
        callback - if null, returns inData
        data - inputs to the first callback
        more - inputs to the first callback
        Returns:
        result from the final callback
        Throws:
        Exception

      • callableRunASync

                        Callback first,
                        Object inData,
                        Object... more)
        By wrapping runASyncInLine() in a Callable, we can now run *everything* off the original thread. However, see CallbackExecutor for a better alternative
        Parameters:
        xs -
        first -
        inData -
        Returns:
        Callable
        See Also:
        for a better alternative

      • callableCallback

        public static <IN,OUT> Callable callableCallback(Callback<IN,OUT> callback,
                                 Exception ex,
                                 IN inData,
                                 Object... more)
        Convert any Callback into a Callable
        Parameters:
        callback - if null this returns null
        ex - input to the Callback
        inData - input to the Callback
        Returns:
        a Callable, or null

      • getMore

        public static Object[] getMore(Callback callback)
        Utility to get the more results (or an empty []) from a callback
        Parameters:
        callback - non-null
        Returns:
        returns [] if callback is not a Callback.ProducesMore

      • getCause

        public static Exception getCause(ExecutionException ee)

        Parameters:
        ee - may be null
        Returns:
        null if ee is null
        Throws:
        Error - if ee wrapped an Error
